title: LoanCare Data Breach: $5.9M Settlement for Affected Customers
author: John Carter

content.intro: LoanCare, a major mortgage servicing company, has agreed to a $5.9 million class-action settlement following a 2023 data breach that exposed sensitive customer information.

sections.title: What Happened?
sections.content: In early 2023, LoanCare suffered a cybersecurity breach where hackers accessed personal data, including names, addresses, Social Security numbers, and mortgage details of over 1.4 million customers.

sections.title: Who Is Eligible for Compensation?
sections.content: All affected U.S. customers who had their data exposed can file a claim. Those who experienced identity theft or financial fraud due to the breach may receive up to $6,500, while others can claim up to $500 for time spent securing their accounts.

sections.title: How to File a Claim
sections.content: Eligible individuals must submit a claim form via the official settlement website by **October 31, 2025**. Documentation (such as fraud reports or credit monitoring receipts) may be required for higher compensations.

sections.title: Additional Protections
sections.content: LoanCare will also provide two years of free credit monitoring and identity theft protection services to all affected customers.
